title: 'Not His Battle To Fight': Ricky Ponting On Sam Konstas' Heated Exchange With Jasprit Bumrah - News18
summary:
Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:36 IST

Former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting criticized Sam Konstas for involving himself in a verbal exchange between Jasprit Bumrah and Usman Khawaja during the Sydney Test. Ponting emphasized that it was unnecessary for Konstas to intervene in the matter.

  • Ponting condemned Konstas' actions, stating it was not his place to step in.
  • He hoped for a discussion in the Australian dressing room regarding the incident.
  • Ponting advised against upsetting Bumrah, who has been impactful in the series.
  • He expressed disdain for time-wasting tactics in cricket, suggesting it can backfire.
  • Australia suffered as Bumrah dismissed Khawaja on the last delivery of Day 1.
“I didn’t like Konstas getting involved. That was not his battle to fight.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the importance of senior players managing their disputes without unnecessary interference from younger players.
newTitle: Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

summary:
Sunil Gavaskar fires back at Australia and England greats

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sunil Gavaskar made critical remarks regarding the reaction of Australian and English cricketers to the performance on a challenging Sydney Test pitch, highlighting a disparity in how similar situations are perceived in India.

  • 15 wickets fell on Day 2 of the fifth Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test.
  • Gavaskar stated that any significant wicket loss in India would lead to widespread criticism of pitch conditions.
  • India's second innings saw Rishabh Pant contributing a quick half-century.
  • Gavaskar emphasized that Indian players do not complain about pitch conditions compared to their foreign counterparts.
  • The Sydney pitch was criticized for lacking ideal conditions for Test cricket.
"You'll never find us complaining. But 15 wickets in a day in India, man, there would be hell."

In conclusion, Gavaskar argues for a more balanced view on pitch conditions and criticizes double standards in cricketing discourse.

title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead - Hindustan Times
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar remained unbeaten at stumps, but India crumbled under pressure, finishing the day at 141/6, leading by 145 runs after Australia was dismissed for 181.

  • Rishabh Pant scored a quickfire half-century off 29 balls before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
  • India struggled throughout the innings with several key players, including Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill, losing their wickets early.
  • Jasprit Bumrah returned to the ground after concerns over his injury, providing a boost to the team.
  • Scott Boland was a standout performer for Australia, taking crucial wickets, including that of Kohli and Gill.
  • India's bowlers, led by Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj, performed well, helping dismiss Australia for 181.
“If Australia don't win in Sydney, they will continue to suffer from a drought of a decade-plus without getting their hands on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.”

The match remains highly competitive as both teams have significant stakes in the outcome, with India's World Test Championship hopes on the line and Australia seeking redemption in the series.

title: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable' - The Times of India
summary:
Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'

Published on: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's Rishabh Pant delivered a stunning performance during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, scoring a rapid 61 runs off 33 balls, which has drawn praise from cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Pant scored 61 runs in just 33 balls at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
  • His 29-ball fifty is the second-fastest for India in Test cricket.
  • He became the fastest visiting batter to reach a Test fifty on Australian soil.
  • Sachin Tendulkar praised Pant's innings as 'truly remarkable' on social media.
  • Pant's innings featured six fours and four sixes, showcasing his explosive batting style.
  • Despite Pant's effort, India ended the day at a precarious 141/6 in the match.

On a wicket where the majority of the batters have batted at a SR of 50 or less, @RishabhPant17's knock with a SR of 184 is truly remarkable. He has rattled Australia from ball one. It is always entertaining to watch him bat. What an impactful innings!

Pant's innings proves his capability to significantly impact crucial matches, and he continues to be a key player for India.
newTitle: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'

title: Rohit Sharma 'not retiring' or 'going anywhere'; India captain quashes speculations: 'I'm a father of two, have sense…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohit Sharma 'not retiring' or 'going anywhere'; India captain quashes speculations

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma has confirmed he is not retiring from cricket nor stepping down as India’s captain, despite speculations stemming from his recent absence in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. He opted to 'stand down' from the Sydney Test for the team's benefit, emphasizing the need for in-form players.

  • Rohit stated he chose to step down due to poor personal performance, scoring only 31 runs in five innings across three Tests.
  • He affirmed his commitment to making a comeback and is not planning to retire from any format.
  • Rohit discussed his decision-making process with coach Gautam Gambhir and selectors, highlighting the importance of performance for team selection.
  • During the Sydney Test, he maintained a leadership role, communicating with the team on the field.
“I’m not going anywhere,” Rohit Sharma told Star Sports, reinforcing his commitment to cricket and the team.

In essence, Rohit Sharma aims to re-establish his form and continue contributing to the Indian cricket team, showing dedication even when stepping back temporarily.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Confirms He Is Not Retiring and Stands by Team Decisions

title: Jasprit Bumrah taken to hospital for scans, Virat Kohli returns as India captain in Sydney - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah's Injury Update Following Hospital Scans

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney Cricket Ground with a niggle during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and underwent scans at a nearby hospital. The nature of his injury is still uncertain, leading to concerns over his participation in the match.

  • Bumrah left the field on Day 2, prompting Virat Kohli to take over as captain.
  • No official update has been provided regarding the extent of Bumrah's injury.
  • He initially left for a short period but returned to bowl one over before leaving the field again.
  • Substitute Abhimanyu Easwaran replaced him in the field.
  • Bumrah's injury may have significant implications for the Test and the series.
  • He had made history by surpassing the previous record for Indian wicket-takers in Australia during this series.
Bumrah had earlier dismissed Marnus Labuschagne, marking his 32nd wicket of the series, breaking Bishan Singh Bedi's long-standing record.

The situation remains tense for the Indian team as they await further updates on Bumrah's condition, which may determine the outcome of the match.
